channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13646] HRegion#execService should not try to build incomplete messages
item.description:
If some RPC service, called on region throws exception, execService still tries to build Message. In case of complex messages with required fields it complicates service code because service need to pass fake protobuf objects, so they can be barely buildable.
To mitigate that I propose to check that controller was failed and return null from call instead of failing with exception.
item.summary: HRegion#execService should not try to build incomplete messages

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Patch:
1. Checking that we have exception and throw it before trying to build() message using Builder.
2. Fixing wrong controller used to call (that is why checks didn't work actually)

(and have long lines because of HBASE-13648)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12731457/HBASE-13646.patch
against master branch at commit 52f635df0061a89f94b010e7cded7796816d7742.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12731457

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 12 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1897 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1896 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest request,
+ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest request,
+ return impl.dummyThrow(controller, (org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest)request);
+ return org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest.getDefaultInstance();
+ return org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyResponse.getDefaultInstance();
+ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest request,
+ this.dummyThrow(controller, (org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest)request,
+ return org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest.getDefaultInstance();
+ return org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyResponse.getDefaultInstance();
+ org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.protobuf.generated.DummyRegionServerEndpointProtos.DummyRequest request,

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13985//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13985//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13985//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13985//console

This message is automatically generated.
style fixes.
Patch looks good Andrey Stepachev What is the context?

stack we are exposing NameNodeProtocol as rpc endpoint in https://github.com/GiraffaFS/giraffa and stumbled on complex protobuf messages which need to be faked to be buildable even if rpc call was unsuccessfull. (for example if there some deep hierarchy of protobuf message with 'required' fields).
So that patch will allow to just throw IOException or DontRetryIOException and rpc handler will not fail with message that it can't build incomplete protobuf message.
Andrey Stepachev +1

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12731526/HBASE-13646.v2.patch
against master branch at commit 220ac141bfcea7798faa5f73295ec61d8b173af9.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12731526

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.TestProcessBasedCluster

Go ahead and commit to branch-1 Andrey Stepachev There is no gatekeeper/RM on branch-1 (Nick is gatekeeper on branch-1.1 and Enis on branch-1.0).

What stack said

This would make it so some coproc running on 1.1.x would be experiencing different environment from running on 1.1.(x+1), so I think it's not acceptable as a semver "patch" level change. Thus please no for branch-1.0 or branch-1.1.
any chance this can go in this weekend?

Are you going to commit Sean Busbey ? Lgtm

Should go in to 0.98 too. if too much trouble leave open with fix versions including 0.98.14 and I'll pick it up early next week
sure. I'll push this later tonight / tomorrow unless someone objects.

change is already in master as of commit 9ba7337ac82d13b22a1b0c40edaba7873c0bd795.
apply branch-1 patch now.

pushed to branch-1, branch-1.2, and 0.98.

Added a release note about the change for coprocessors; would appreciate a quick review to make sure it's correct.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: When RegionServerCoprocessors throw an exception we will no longer attempt to build an incomplete RPC response message. Instead, the response message will be null.
